name: Nicotine Gum (Nicorette)
summary: A nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in chewing gum form to aid smoking cessation by reducing withdrawal symptoms and nicotine cravings.
description: Nicotine gum is an over-the-counter nicotine replacement therapy designed to help people quit smoking by delivering controlled doses of nicotine without the harmful chemicals found in tobacco smoke. Chewing the gum releases nicotine, which is absorbed through the oral mucosa. It helps reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms during smoking cessation efforts.

metadata.fda_pregnancy_category: D (risk if continued smoking outweighs use in pregnancy; NRT use should be supervised)

sections.text: Provides controlled nicotine delivery via buccal absorption, stimulating nicotinic acetylcholine receptors to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms.

adult.typical: Chew 1 piece every 1–2 hours for the first 6 weeks, then gradually extend intervals
adult.strengths: 2 mg for smokers of <25 cigarettes/day; 4 mg for ≥25 cigarettes/day

sections.tapering: Reduce total pieces chewed per day over 12 weeks until discontinuation

sections.text: Nicotine peak levels occur within 15–30 minutes; effects last 1–2 hours.

other: Chew slowly until peppery taste emerges, then 'park' between cheek and gum to enhance absorption
Avoid acidic beverages 15 minutes before and during use to improve nicotine absorption

items.risk: Smoking cessation may alter drug metabolism

items: Blood pressure and heart rate in at-risk patients

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks and under supervision
sections.lactation: Nicotine passes into breast milk; avoid or use immediately after breastfeeding
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended under age 18 without medical supervision

sections.text: Gradually reduce the number of pieces per day over a 12-week period.

items: Part of a comprehensive smoking cessation program including behavioral support
More effective when combined with other NRT forms or medications in resistant cases
